page.title: 11MARKETS, BRADFORD
page.content:
Shoppers in Bradford are well provided for by three Council Markets.
{Kirkgate Market}(1973) forms part of the Kirkgate Shopping Centre. Some 185 stalls provide miscellaneous goods and a variety of cafes are available. {Rawson Market,}over 100 years old, & {James St Fish Market }have 99 stalls providing fish, poultry & game,meat, & fruit and vegetables. Continental foods, bakery products and flowers are also available as well as the{famous {Mitchell's Tripe Shop. }Here you can meet the traditional hustle & bustle of a market. {John St Market }(rebuilt 1977 after fire) has 178 stalls providing a wide range of miscellaneous goods, a variety of food stalls & several cafes and snack bars.
